sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: President of the European Commission Ursula von der Leyen is back in Davos and shares a clear message of support to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Ukraine, intense fighting continues over the city of Bakhmut and the UN finally sends experts in the hope of securing nuclear power plants.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Europe braces for winter as ice and snow sweep across the north of the Iberian Peninsula, bringing travel chaos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The president of the European Commission, named the most powerful woman on the planet last year, is in Davos and showed her full support to Ukraine yet again.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In a long-awaited speech, Ursula von der Leyen delivered a message that she hopes will be heard in both Moscow and Kyiv.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: There will be no let-up in our steadfast support to Ukraine, from helping to restore power, heating and water, to preparing for the long-term effort of reconstruction.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And to reaffirm that support, we announced yesterday that the Commission is delivering 3 billion euros of financial support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is the first tranche of our 18 billion support package for 2023, the largest ever macrofinancial assistance to a a third country European aid has helped Ukraine resist the Russian invasion through funding and military supplies it has also helped the Ukrainian economy and infrastructure key targets of the invasion keeping European leaders awake

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: at night the inflation reduction act the massive subsidy scheme carried out by the US administration puts investments in Europe at risk by diverting them to the other side of the Atlantic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Speaking here at the World Economic Forum in Davos, the European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen announced a plan up her sleeve, a new net zero industry act that would quote simplify and fast track permitting for new clean tech production sites. Ursula von der Leyen made it clear that a common financial instrument would be needed. To avoid fragmenting of the single market and to support the clean tech transition across the whole Union we must also step up EU funding for the medium term we will prepare European sovereignty fund as part of the midterm review of our budget this year the crucial question though how to balance EU money and national state aid whose rules have been already loosened with a temporary crisis framework. Six countries, Denmark, Finland, Ireland, the Netherlands, Poland and Sweden are urging the European Commission to exercise great caution. State aid can lead to a so-called subsidy race and the fragmentation of the internal market. Just the state aid can't help all the country, but just someone like, for example, Germany or France that have more space, more possibility.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: So what we think is now necessary, and it is necessary now, not too late, is a new recovery fund.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Some EU member states have more fiscal wriggle room than others.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: They can afford to subsidise their own industrial sector.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Germany and France, for example, represent 77% of the 672 billions of state aid approved under the current temporary crisis framework.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: of state aid approved under the current temporary crisis framework. Hydrogen, electric batteries, solar panels and semiconductors should be included in a list of strategic industrial projects for which state aid should be more massive, both by subsidies and by tax credit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The Commission will present concrete proposals by the end of January to feed discussions at the next European Council meeting taking place in February.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The clock is ticking.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Davos.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In Ukraine, fighting around the eastern front line city of Bakhmut remains intense, with both sides determined to hold their ground.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: To advance, Ukraine desperately needs tanks of the type the UK has just announced it will send.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Poland is poised to send a squadron of German-made Leopard 2 tanks, but that needs Berlin's approval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: At the World Economic Forum, the Polish president expressed his hope that it would come soon. The pressure of political, German political stage and German public opinion is becoming stronger and stronger and stronger.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So I hope that the result of all that elements, that all that elements will result in this very, very, very, very needed decision.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In another development, the UN's atomic agency, the IAEA, has finally started deploying experts at four sites to ensure the safe operation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The idea is to leave a group of experts behind in each location to support Ukrainian staff. hand in hand with our Ukrainian hosts to facilitate some technical support, delivery of equipment to make sure that all these facilities can continue running normally and without any problem.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Ukraine also needs economic support. That's what EU finance ministers have been discussing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They're aiming to find ways to secure long-term, sustainable financial backing for the war-ravaged country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Spain and Portugal are braced for further wintry storms

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: after heavy snowfall across the north of the Iberian Peninsula.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: They're part of a pattern of severe weather systems throughout much of Europe. Strong winds and southern downloads of snow brought chaos to travellers in mountainous areas of northern Spain.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It's a wonderful night, but we're stuck here. Without snow tyres we can't get through.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: France, Ireland and the UK have also been hit with an icy blast, including Cornwall in western England.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The cold snap comes just after unseasonably warmer weather across much of the continent that resulted in a different kind of problem in Finland.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Higher than average winter temperatures there have accelerated the melting of snow, which is combined with recent heavy rains leading to widespread flooding. Water levels have risen sharply in parts of the west and south of the country.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: After 30 years in hiding, Italy's number one fugitive was arrested on Monday in Sicily.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Mafia mobster Matteo Messina Denaro is considered the top boss of Cosa Nostra and is claimed to have once said he filled a cemetery all by himself.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite his filmic reputation, which conjures images of the godfather, the 60-year-old's arrest didn't require a car chase. He was captured by police at a private hospital in Palermo. The Italian prime minister flew to Sicily on Monday, where she visited a monument to the assassinated anti-mafia prosecutor Giovanni Falcone, one of the mobster's victims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Meloni personally congratulated the Sicilian authorities on the arrest and said, this is a great victory for the state.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Days after appearing in a UK court to deny allegations of sexual assault, Kevin Spacey has picked up a Lifetime Achievement Award in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: In his first official speaking engagement since the hashtag MeToo era allegations, the embattled actor visited the city of Turin where he was honored for his contribution to cinema. This comes after Spacey appeared at London's Southwark Crown Court by video link on Friday to deny three counts of indecent assault, three counts of sexual assaults and one count of causing a person to engage in sexual activity without consent. Spacey has previously denied five other allegations in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The World Economic Forum's co-founder presented the British actor Idris Elba and his Somali-Canadian wife Sabrina Dawa Elba with crystal awards to honour their commitment to food security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: to honour their commitment to food security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They need your guidance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The poor of this world are not just looking for aid and handouts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They are looking for investment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Investment in people, in nature, in innovation, in partnership.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: The Elbers are goodwill ambassadors for the UN's International Fund for Agricultural Development and give voice to the needs of small farmers from poorer countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Davos gave them a chance to appeal to some of the richest investors in the world.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Tennis Australia has banned Russian and Belarusian flags at the Australian Open tournament after an incident during a match between a Ukrainian and a Russian player.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The decision was made after members of the crowd unfurled a Russian flag when Ukraine's Kateryna Bindul was playing Russia's Kamila Rakymova and in a men's tie involving Daniil Medvedev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Ukrainian fans claim Russian supporters were taunting Bindul and say they alerted police and security.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Moscow has called the decision an unacceptable politicization of sports.
